bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Robert F. Belden, from Danbury, Connecticut, graduated from the Connecticut Agricultural College in 1920. While at C.A.C., Belden was a member of Sigma Alpha Pi, Gamma Chi Epsilon and editor of the student newspaper.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains papers produced by Mr. Belden while he was a student at the Connecticut Agricultural College.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series I: Papers, (1919-1921) includes papers, clippings and reports.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to the University, its history, faculty, staff and students. See especially, University Memorabilia Collection, and the papers of A. J. Brundage, James R. Case, Fitts Family, Donald and Margaret Gaylord, Albert C. and Ralph D. Gilbert, Charles G. Hall, Lena Hurlburt, Howard Merrill, Lawrence F. Morico, A. J. Pierpont, Phil Samponaro, August Schulze, Randolph and Beatrice Whaples, and Stanley D. Woodmansee in addition to administrative records. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.
